title: Font only changed via "Other Writing Systems", not on a per-script basis
content:
I received some Arabic-language emails written in the Perso–Arabic script. The default fonts severely impede Arabic readability, so I went about changing them. I accessed the fonts configuration via the "Advanced" button in the "Language & Appearance" section. Font settings per writing system (Latin, Arabic, etc.) are ostensibly offered, but I have not observed any such settings take effect after experimenting with the Arabic and Latin settings.

I have managed to only change the fonts globally (i.e. across all scripts) via "Other Writing Systems". Did those per-script font settings become deprecated at some point, or am I interpreting/using it wrong?
creator: anonymous-vR3wO

title: Inoltro inviti Google Calendar tramite Thunderbird
content: Buongiorno, ho installato da poco Thunderbird su 2 PC Windws e utilizzo il calendario di Google in lettura/scrittura, funziona tutto perfettamente l'unica cosa che non riesco a risolvere è la modalità di inoltro degli inviti ai partecipanti ad un evento, in pratica l'invito viene inviato 2 volte, la prima come utente Gmail(che non vorrei venisse utilizzata) la seconda con la mail del client(che vorrei venisse utilizzata). Nell'impostazione del calendario in Thunderbird è selezionata l'opzione "preferire la pianificazione delle mail su client". Come posso risolvere il doppio invio di mail preferendo quella del client a quella di Gmail? Grazie.

title: Accessing the address book programmatically?
content:
Hi,

I would like to integrate the user's address book (or more specifically the contact details of the current user) into my own (c++) desktop (Windows/MacOS/Linux) application for the user's convenience.

Is this possible at all? If so, where can I start reading to find out how to do this?

(If it's not possible through an API, is the address book file format documented somewhere, so I can read it directly?)

I don't need write access. I just need to be able to read the user's contacts.

Cheers, James
creator: crazydef

title: Option to ask the user to save or discard messages after sending an email
content:
Hello! Seriously considering Thunderbird after the recent refresh and am super delighted to see your collective contributions. A big thanks at the outset! I handle about 100 emails a day (both in and outbound) and have to keep going to the sent box towards the close of the day to delete all emails which i had to respond to but have no future use for. Could you introduce a feature in Thunderbird where the user is asked whether he/she wishes to save the email just after sending it? A "yes" retains the email in the sent box while a "no" does not. That way, i dont have to go to my sent box and go through numerous emails at the end of the day to keep my mailboxes clean.

Secondly, could you introduce the ability to compose signatures within the application itself please?

Just wanted to leave these two thoughts here. Wishing you the best for many more iterations of a truly wonderful outlook alternative!
creator: anvarlaksh

title: Sähköpostitili kaatuilee!?
content:
Hei! Minulla on isoja ongelmia MozillaThunderin kanssa. Olen käyttänyt ohjelmaa kohta 20 vuotta ja kaikki on mennyt hyvin. Mutta nyt on kaksi viikkoa mennyt pieleen.. Minulla on kolme postilokeroa käytössä harri.hautala@hetemark.fi kalajoenrealisointi@hetemark.fi tilitoimisto@hetemark.fi

Näistä pääpostini harri.hautala tökkii... Se menee niinku jumiin ja monta kertaa päivän aikana. Ensin tulee teksti huomautus, että yhteysttä ei saada ja kun odottelee, kohta kaikki lokeron postit on kadoksissa ja ne alkaa lataantumaan uudelleen. Erittäin ikävää ja haastavaa, kun pitäisi kirjoittaa viestejä tai vastailla, kun se menee niin hitaaksi. Kännykällä ja tabletilla toimii normaalisti. Olen käyttöliittymän asentanut kolmeen tietokoneeseen ja kolmeen kännykkään/tablettiin. Näissä mobililaitteissa ei ole ongelmaa(android) Osaatteko auttaa, miksi tämä uudelleen latasu aina vaan alkaa uudelleen? TÄmä ongelma on siis vain yhdessä postissa. ASensimme sen uudelleenkin, ei auttanut... Mielestäni tämä ongelma alkoi, kun tuli uusin päivitys.

Olisin kiitollinen neuvoista! tv. Harri Hautala
creator: harri.hautala

title: Thunderbird doesn't wait for password entry, but tries to access mail without authorization
content:
Occasionally I will get distracted between starting Thunderbird and entering the primary/master password. This is usually due to not having my password manager open, and/or problems with the PW manager, or getting an important phone call.

Thunderbird asks for the PW, but if I don't enter it "in time" it will go ahead and try to access my email accounts online, but without having access to the application passwords/tokens. This causes a slew of errors, requests for authorizations and other problems. I usually end up canceling the task - because just closing Thunderbird doesn't stop the insanity.

If I have a primary/master PW, Thunderbird should WAIT, and not try to do anything, until that password is correctly entered. That would solve a bunch of issues.

Thunderbird: 128.5.2esr (64-bit) Release notes Thunderbird for Linux Mintmint-001 - 1.0 Updates disabled by your system administrator

System: 

 Kernel: 6.8.0-51-generic arch: x86_64 bits: 64 compiler: gcc v: 13.3.0 clocksource: tsc  Desktop: Cinnamon v: 6.2.9 tk: GTK v: 3.24.41 wm: Muffin v: 6.2.0 vt: 7 dm: LightDM v: 1.30.0    Distro: Linux Mint 22 Wilma base: Ubuntu 24.04 noble
creator: DebraBk

title: Choppy response times with Thunderbird
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for many years, and its up to date. I've had more and more problems with choppy response times lately. It "freezes" for short periods where the interface stops responding for half a minute, or a minute or so before I can do anything. It always comes back (never crashes, shuts down). Today was some of the worst where it was minutes before I could start using it.

My junk and trash folders are empty, and I've done a compression and run the cleanup operation on a bunch of folders. My Inbox is empty. I only have 2 pop accounts. Its not when its retrieving or sending email though.
creator: ian237

title: Suddenly unable to log in to inbound.att.net with 1 of 2 accounts on 2 different computers
content: On Wednesday 12/11 at approx 4PM PT, Thunderbird stopped being able to log in to my sbcglobal.net POP3 account. It had been receiving emails routinely up to that time. There are two error messages associated with this. One happens if TB has been open and I ask it to download new messages using the little cloud symbol or “Get Messages”: “The account xxx@sbcglobal.net is being processed. Please wait until processing is complete to get messages.” Or if I open TB and it just starts with the login process, the error messages is a popup: “Connection to server inbound.att.net timed out.” TB manages two other accounts, both of which are functioning normally. One of them is also an sbcglobal.net account, and both sbcglobal accounts are set up identically: Port 995, SSL/TLS, Secure Mail Key (rather than OAuth2). Version is 115.18.0 32bit, Windows 22H2. Logging in to the server via a browser shows many emails that have arrived since the problem started. I have gotten nowhere with ATT/SBC, they don't seem to want to provide any support anymore if they hear the word Thunderbird. Can you help?
creator: JimFxSpt

title: Finding stored passwords

Please tell me how / where to find stored passwords now.

title: copy and paste problems in CardBook
content: In certain instances, I can no longer copy/cut from Cardbook notes. This happened in last few months. I just have time now to post the problem. I know since then Thunderbird had updates and so had windows. I am on Thunderbird 128.5.2esr and Windows 11 and firefox 133.0.3 I used to be able to select a word or many words and then right click. Then copy or paste would show up as option in a list. Now no list shows up. But control c and control v sometimes works. If I control c and control v within the note that works. I can copy from something like Word and control c and paste using control v and vice versa. But if try control c in notes and then control v in website that does not work. And that is what I use most.
creator: tina589

title: How to change the width of mail folder columns?
content:
(1) In Thunderbird v. 128.5.2, I find that when I adjust the column widths for one mail folder, it changes the widths for all the other folders as well. This isn't a big deal for me since I want to have the widths the same in all folders, but what's the point of having the "apply columns to..." feature if one has no choice but to do that anyway?

(2) More frustrating is that if I try to increase the width of a column by dragging its right border to the right, it not only decreases the width of columns to the right as expected, but also decreases the width of columns to the left. Or if I try to increase the width by dragging the left border to the left, instead of increasing the width of the column I'm trying to adjust, instead it increases the width of the right-most column, and seems to make a multitude of adjustments to other columns that I don't understand. Is there a way to get the column sizer to work in the normal way? Any help would be appreciated!
creator: coffent1
